alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 3:03AM CST until December 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills may reach as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions are possible, especially late Wednesday night through Thursday morning. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. A light glaze of ice could accumulate Wednesday afternoon and evening prior to the snow. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph will be possible at times. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight Wednesday night to noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 6 PM Wednesday evening through 6 PM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is an exceptionally cold period, especially from late Wednesday night through Saturday. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
